kanban_cards.title: 💾 LLM Capacity Orchestration - Distributed Model Management
kanban_cards.description: EVERGREEN LLM CAPACITY OPTIMIZATION: CURRENT CAPACITY: War Chief GPU 0: llama3.2:1b (1B params), War Chief GPU 1: codellama:7b (7B params), Enhanced DevOps: codellama:13b (13B params), Future GMKtec cluster: 4x70B capability (280B total). LEAST RESISTANCE STRATEGIES: 1) MODEL ROUTING: Size-appropriate routing (small queries → small models), Expertise routing (code → codellama, chat → llama), Load balancing across available nodes. 2) MODEL CACHING: Keep hot models in GPU memory, Preload frequently used models, Quantization for memory efficiency (Q4, Q5, Q8). 3) DISTRIBUTED INFERENCE: Pipeline parallelism for large models, Tensor parallelism within nodes, Batch processing for efficiency. 4) STORAGE HIERARCHY: Model weights: NVMe for active, SSD for standby, Embeddings: RAM cache → NVMe → PostgreSQL, Context: Redis/RAM → Vector DB → Archive. CONTINUOUS EVOLUTION: Monitor token/second per watt, Track model usage patterns, Optimize quantization levels, Evaluate new model architectures. FUTURE VISION: Self-selecting model routing, Automatic scaling based on load, Predictive model preloading, Energy-aware scheduling

kanban_cards.title: 🌊 Evergreen: Data Flow Path of Least Resistance
kanban_cards.description: PHILOSOPHY: Like water finding its natural course, data and LLM operations must flow through paths of least resistance. This is an EVERGREEN initiative - never complete, always evolving. CORE PRINCIPLES: 1) DATA GRAVITY: Keep data close to compute (minimize movement), Store frequently accessed data in fastest tier, Cache embeddings near LLM nodes. 2) THERMAL DYNAMICS: Hot data → RAM/NVMe on active nodes, Warm data → Local SSD storage, Cold data → Network storage/archives. 3) COMPUTE AFFINITY: Route requests to nearest capable model, Shard large models across high-bandwidth nodes, Colocate related workloads. 4) RESISTANCE POINTS TO ELIMINATE: Network latency between data and compute, Memory pressure causing swap, Disk I/O bottlenecks, Power/thermal throttling, Database query inefficiencies. CONTINUOUS OPTIMIZATION CYCLES: Weekly: Review query patterns and cache hits, Monthly: Rebalance data placement, Quarterly: Evaluate new storage/compute tiers, Annually: Architecture evolution assessment. METRICS: Data locality score (% processed locally), Average latency per operation, Power per inference/token, Cache hit ratios across tiers. SEVEN GENERATIONS VIEW: Build self-optimizing systems that learn flow patterns, Create knowledge that improves with use, Design for 100x scale without 100x complexity
